Hacky slashy Dev Crit Orc. I imagine that, somewhere amongst the 3,000+ old epic character builds that there's something like this. The disarm feat was a throwaway and is now Great Fortitude instead, and the feat progression's a little more polished.

With regards to skills: Discipline 43, Tumble 40 and Lore 8 are a must have. With regards to Spellcraft, Taunt and UMD: This will depend on the conditions of the module.


If there is spell immunity gear available [which there was where this character was created, there was also an additional spellcheck for scroll use for bards of 20 + scroll level hence the 27 spellcraft originally], it may not be worth maxing this out.

If there are high level magic items requiring UMD over 15 [like there were where this character was originally created], it may be worth shifting some taunt points into this skill. 

Having a taunt above 20 may be handy for high AC opponents with Low Concentration. Again, this can be juggled with spellcraft and UMD depending on the conditions of the module.



But!

For the best all round combination for the everyman, then probably 42 Spellcraft, and some combination of UMD above 10 for scroll use, and Taunt for whatever's left, should be sufficient.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
theflyingrodent wrote:
Out of curiousity: Can builds from this forum be transported to build forums once they've been polished and appropriately formatted? Or do they have to be completely reposted?

 
Yeah, they can, but it's sloppy because many times the final version appears well down in the thread and we don't want to make potential users hunt through a topic trying to find the real McCoy do we?

Copy/paste of Forumer edit data should paste as WYSIWYG, without any need for additional reformatting to make it match.  If you wish to link back to the original discussion, that's usually a good idea so that the same issues don't get hashed over again.

Maybe compare/contrast this with Xylo's Munchkin the Dwarf Dragon Wannabe fighter 28 / bard 2 / red dragon disciple 10.  It's an EDR version of this combo. And there are a few others listed as well, though many seem a tad misdirected.

Ummm... I noticed your Spellcraft has not been maxed/optimized.  Or Taunt. You do realize that a bard dump at 40 can reach a modified 45 for +9 vs spells, right?  All that is needed to cast all scrolls without failure is a net UMD 10.  That's how the hardcore scroll check works for bard's UMD only. The rest of the skill investment you've allocated is just to equip/use expensive class-specific gear and that is an environment-specific choice rather than a power-optimized one.  I'd use the excess to max both Spellcraft (actually, 42 ranks is enough to reach 45 with INT 16) and Taunt...  since we are focusing on a "power" build, eh?  The half-orc choice means it will be Taunt bait (no Conc) but at least be equally empowered to even the roll a bit better against those types.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
theflyingrodent wrote:
Now: I suppose the elephant in the room question is: Is it possible to integrate those 2,000+ builds into the neat little Build Filter that you guys have for the 200 or so that you have here? Yes I imagine this would take hundreds of hours.


 
Your estimate is probably off by a factor of about 100x or so. 

When there was a team of 2 working on this initiative, that exact alternate was proposed.  I agreed it would be "nice" but questioned the feasibility.  Eventaully, the team was reduced to 1 for some RL reasons.

Now fast-forward to the present.  It took about 6 months to port all the current ECB Level 40 builds into the spreadsheet.  How many hours was that?  One could only guess.  Probably 8-15 hours a week or as long I could last until my eyesight and brain began to atrophy.  Right now, I am about to release Version 2 to contain all the pre-epic and Bioware legacy builds.  That's another 65-ish more complete builds.  Plus all the corrections to the screw-ups of the first release (and there were many!).  There's another 3 months.

The key issue is that there is no easy way to glean the detail that the filter provides from the previous guild's archive file.  I also did a certain amount of validation to ensure each build was actually playable as listed.  In some cases, like the server-specific builds, it was extremely tedious to modify the CBC to accommodate all the customizations (like subrace abilities, feats, skill boosts, etc.) but needed to be done so that the posted values had some validity.

But in that mass of 2000+ builds, there is a mish-mash of pre v1.69 contributions plus the fact that many were too poorly formatted to be able to assess them easily.  I'd expect that trying to make some sense of the majority of builds in that group would be far harder than those of our current ECB Guild because the CBC was not made available for most of them.  Builders were designing toons on paper without the sweet algorithms Kamiryn built into her spreadsheet to save all the guesswork and manual validation.

In short: Possible, but highly improbable. I wouldn't hold my breath.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
theflyingrodent wrote:
Edited for the sake of everyone's vision. Turns out that for some reason, Pasting into Notepad and then here creates more problems than just directing pasting from the excel spreadsheet. Dunno why.


 
Try this:  Highlight Excel Col C, Row 6 and drag to the last skill row (should be Row 109) on the output tab and key CTRL-C (that will highlight all the cells selected with a little flashing dashed outline). 

Then open MSWord, click Edit, Paste Special, Unformatted Text, click OK.
There should not be any evidence of cells around the lines.

Then select... Edit, Select All, Edit, Copy.

Open Notepad (not WordPad).  Make sure Wordwrap is NOT checked. Then Edit, Paste.  That should be pure ASCII text without any formatting.

Then, in Notepad... Edit, Select All, Edit, Copy.  (yes, once again to clear the clipboard buffer of the MSWord format and use the Notepad data)

Then click into the Forumer editor and key CTRL-P.  Do not try to paste as a table.  The pasted text should be WYSIWYG to match exactly what you viewed in Notepad, no table cells.

You shouldn't need the extra step with MSWord, but I felt it good to test if any formatting from Excel got through to MSWord on the Paste Special/Unformatted Text.  If it did, your clipboard is retaining formatting and it shouldn't.  Let me know the results because I may need to check how to change the default dynamics of the Clipboard.  I use Win7 so it may not match your OS (which would probably be a good thing to know anyway).   If it's a MAC OS, hell I haven't a clue. :(
